Block-Based Python Programming

About Us

Welcome to Misty Showcase – a student-led project developed at the Technologisches Gewerbemuseum (TGM), a Higher Technical College located in Vienna's 20th district.

We are all students of class 4BHIT, and we've worked together on this project as part of our yearly ITP course (IT-Technische Projekte).

What Is Misty Showcase?

The goal of Misty Showcase is to create an engaging demonstration using the Misty II robot. Visitors can control Misty through an interactive maze by programming simple instructions using Google Blockly, a visual coding interface. As the user creates the logic, the equivalent Python code is automatically displayed, helping them connect visual programming with real code.

This project serves as both an introduction to robotics and a fun way to experience basic programming concepts.

How Does It Work?

  • A local webserver runs the application using Node.js and npm.
  • Users interact with Google Blockly to build their robot logic.
  • Pyodide compiles and runs Python directly in the browser.
  • The robot is controlled in real time via the Misty REST API.
  • A custom Python connector ties everything together.

Challenges We're Facing

Working with Misty's REST API has introduced some technical hurdles. For instance, every new command cancels any currently running command, and latency causes noticeable delays in execution. These are ongoing challenges we're tackling as we continue to refine the experience.

Why This Matters

While Misty Showcase may not aim to reinvent the wheel, it gives visitors a tangible, hands-on way to explore how programming and robotics intersect – and perhaps inspires some to dig deeper.

Misty Showcase

A student-led project developed at the Technologisches Gewerbemuseum (TGM), bringing robotics and programming together in an interactive experience.
